title: Flora: scenes from a leadership convention
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Women
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Canada - Politics and government

Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Women - Canada
description: A fresh, incisive look at Canadian politics, this film penetrates the surface glitter of the 1976 Progressive Conservative Party leadership convention, focusing on the campaign of Cape Bretoner Flora MacDonald, the first woman to contest her party's leadership. (Follow-up film: Reflections on a Leadership Convention.)
